channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Enhancing social network hate detection using back translation and GPT-3 augmentations during training and test-time
item.description: Social media platforms have become an essential means of communication, but they also serve as a breeding ground for hateful content.

item.title: Uncertainty Quantification via Spatial-Temporal Tweedie Model for Zero-inflated and Long-tail Travel Demand Prediction
item.description: crucial for transportation management.

item.title: Jumanji: a Diverse Suite of Scalable Reinforcement Learning Environments in JAX
item.description: Open-source reinforcement learning (RL) environments have played a crucial role in driving progress in the development of AI algorithms.

item.title: Sheffield's Submission to the AmericasNLP Shared Task on Machine Translation into Indigenous Languages
item.description: In this paper we describe the University of Sheffield's submission to the AmericasNLP 2023 Shared Task on Machine Translation into Indigenous Languages which comprises the translation from Spanish to eleven indigenous languages.

item.title: Listener Model for the PhotoBook Referential Game with CLIPScores as Implicit Reference Chain
item.description: PhotoBook is a collaborative dialogue game where two players receive private, partially-overlapping sets of images and resolve which images they have in common.

item.title: Full Parameter Fine-tuning for Large Language Models with Limited Resources
item.description: Large Language Models (LLMs) have revolutionized Natural Language Processing (NLP) but demand massive GPU resources for training.

item.title: RED$^{\rm FM}$: a Filtered and Multilingual Relation Extraction Dataset
item.description: Relation Extraction (RE) is a task that identifies relationships between entities in a text, enabling the acquisition of relational facts and bridging the gap between natural language and structured knowledge.

item.title: LabelBench: A Comprehensive Framework for Benchmarking Label-Efficient Learning
item.description: Labeled data are critical to modern machine learning applications, but obtaining labels can be expensive.

item.title: Super-Resolution Radar Imaging with Sparse Arrays Using a Deep Neural Network Trained with Enhanced Virtual Data
item.description: The key to this performance is that the DNN is trained using realistic simulation data that perfectly mimic a given sparse antenna radar array hardware as the input.

item.title: From Hypergraph Energy Functions to Hypergraph Neural Networks
item.description: Hypergraphs are a powerful abstraction for representing higher-order interactions between entities of interest.

item.title: FewSAR: A Few-shot SAR Image Classification Benchmark
item.description: Motivated by this observation, we propose a novel few-shot SAR image classification benchmark (FewSAR) to address this issue.

item.title: FETNet: Feature Erasing and Transferring Network for Scene Text Removal
item.description: To tackle these problems, we propose a novel Feature Erasing and Transferring (FET) mechanism to reconfigure the encoded features for STR in this paper.

item.title: Using DUCK-Net for polyp image segmentation
item.description: This paper presents a novel supervised convolutional neural network architecture, “DUCK-Net”, capable of effectively learning and generalizing from small amounts of medical images to perform accurate segmentation tasks.

item.title: Gradient is All You Need?
item.description: The fundamental value of such link between CBO and SGD lies in the fact that CBO is provably globally convergent to global minimizers for ample classes of nonsmooth and nonconvex objective functions, hence, on the one side, offering a novel explanation for the success of stochastic relaxations of gradient descent.

item.title: HomoGCL: Rethinking Homophily in Graph Contrastive Learning
item.description: Contrastive learning (CL) has become the de-facto learning paradigm in self-supervised learning on graphs, which generally follows the "augmenting-contrasting" learning scheme.

item.title: Cross-Domain Toxic Spans Detection
item.description: Given the dynamic nature of toxic language use, automated methods for detecting toxic spans are likely to encounter distributional shift.

item.title: CLIP2Protect: Protecting Facial Privacy using Text-Guided Makeup via Adversarial Latent Search
item.description: We propose a novel two-step approach for facial privacy protection that relies on finding adversarial latent codes in the low-dimensional manifold of a pretrained generative model.

item.title: Framework and Benchmarks for Combinatorial and Mixed-variable Bayesian Optimization
item.description: This paper introduces a modular framework for Mixed-variable and Combinatorial Bayesian Optimization (MCBO) to address the lack of systematic benchmarking and standardized evaluation in the field.

item.title: A Hierarchical Bayesian Model for Deep Few-Shot Meta Learning
item.description: We propose a novel hierarchical Bayesian model for learning with a large (possibly infinite) number of tasks/episodes, which suits well the few-shot meta learning problem.

item.title: Nearly-Optimal Hierarchical Clustering for Well-Clustered Graphs
item.description: This paper presents two efficient hierarchical clustering (HC) algorithms with respect to Dasgupta's cost function.

item.title: Discourse Representation Structure Parsing for Chinese
item.description: Previous work has predominantly focused on monolingual English semantic parsing.

item.title: FALL-E: A Foley Sound Synthesis Model and Strategies
item.description: This paper introduces FALL-E, a foley synthesis system and its training/inference strategies.

item.title: Squeezing nnU-Nets with Knowledge Distillation for On-Board Cloud Detection
item.description: Cloud detection is a pivotal satellite image pre-processing step that can be performed both on the ground and on board a satellite to tag useful images.

item.title: Subset Selection Based On Multiple Rankings in the Presence of Bias: Effectiveness of Fairness Constraints for Multiwinner Voting Score Functions
item.description: We consider the problem of subset selection where one is given multiple rankings of items and the goal is to select the highest ``quality'' subset.

item.title: Politeness Stereotypes and Attack Vectors: Gender Stereotypes in Japanese and Korean Language Models
item.description: Non-English bias research, however, is still in its infancy with most work focusing on English.

item.title: Amortized Inference for Gaussian Process Hyperparameters of Structured Kernels
item.description: We propose amortizing kernel parameter inference over a complete kernel-structure-family rather than a fixed kernel structure.

item.title: GraphSHA: Synthesizing Harder Samples for Class-Imbalanced Node Classification
item.description: Class imbalance is the phenomenon that some classes have much fewer instances than others, which is ubiquitous in real-world graph-structured scenarios.

item.title: Fedstellar: A Platform for Decentralized Federated Learning
item.description: To overcome these challenges, this paper presents Fedstellar, a novel platform designed to train FL models in a decentralized, semi-decentralized, and centralized fashion across diverse federations of physical or virtualized devices.

item.title: Group Orthogonalization Regularization For Vision Models Adaptation and Robustness
item.description: As neural networks become deeper, the redundancy within their parameters increases.

item.title: BISCUIT: Causal Representation Learning from Binary Interactions
item.description: Identifying the causal variables of an environment and how to intervene on them is of core value in applications such as robotics and embodied AI.

item.title: How do different tokenizers perform on downstream tasks in scriptio continua languages?: A case study in Japanese
item.description: This paper investigates the effect of tokenizers on the downstream performance of pretrained language models (PLMs) in scriptio continua languages where no explicit spaces exist between words, using Japanese as a case study.

item.title: Structured Cooperative Learning with Graphical Model Priors
item.description: We propose "Structured Cooperative Learning (SCooL)", in which a cooperation graph across devices is generated by a graphical model prior to automatically coordinate mutual learning between devices.

item.title: Evaluation of Speech Representations for MOS prediction
item.description: Among the supervised and self-supervised learning models using BRSpeechMOS, Whisper-Small achieved the best linear correlation of 0. 6980, and the speaker verification model, SpeakerNet, had linear correlation of 0. 6963.

item.title: MagicBrush: A Manually Annotated Dataset for Instruction-Guided Image Editing
item.description: To address this issue, we introduce MagicBrush (https://osu-nlp-group. github. io/MagicBrush/), the first large-scale, manually annotated dataset for instruction-guided real image editing that covers diverse scenarios: single-turn, multi-turn, mask-provided, and mask-free editing.

item.title: OMS-DPM: Optimizing the Model Schedule for Diffusion Probabilistic Models
item.description: Diffusion probabilistic models (DPMs) are a new class of generative models that have achieved state-of-the-art generation quality in various domains.

item.title: QH9: A Quantum Hamiltonian Prediction Benchmark for QM9 Molecules
item.description: Supervised machine learning approaches have been increasingly used in accelerating electronic structure prediction as surrogates of first-principle computational methods, such as density functional theory (DFT).

item.title: QuadSwarm: A Modular Multi-Quadrotor Simulator for Deep Reinforcement Learning with Direct Thrust Control
item.description: In addition to speed, such simulators need to model the physics of the robots and their interaction with the environment to a level acceptable for transferring policies learned in simulation to reality.

item.title: Explore, Establish, Exploit: Red Teaming Language Models from Scratch
item.description: The red team is expected to refine/extend this specification and identify methods to elicit this behavior from the model.

item.title: Decentralized Social Navigation with Non-Cooperative Robots via Bi-Level Optimization
item.description: This paper presents a fully decentralized approach for realtime non-cooperative multi-robot navigation in social mini-games, such as navigating through a narrow doorway or negotiating right of way at a corridor intersection.

item.title: Pragmatic Inference with a CLIP Listener for Contrastive Captioning
item.description: We propose a simple yet effective and robust method for contrastive captioning: generating discriminative captions that distinguish target images from very similar alternative distractor images.

item.title: Semantic HELM: An Interpretable Memory for Reinforcement Learning
item.description: Then we feed these tokens to a pretrained language model that serves the agent as memory and provides it with a coherent and interpretable representation of the past.

item.title: Understanding and Mitigating Extrapolation Failures in Physics-Informed Neural Networks
item.description: By analyzing the Fourier spectra of the solution functions, we characterize the PDEs that yield favorable extrapolation behavior, and show that the presence of high frequencies in the solution function is not to blame for poor extrapolation behavior.

item.title: SIGHT: A Large Annotated Dataset on Student Insights Gathered from Higher Education Transcripts
item.description: To overcome this challenge, we propose a set of best practices for using large language models (LLMs) to cheaply classify the comments at scale.

item.title: Neural models for Factual Inconsistency Classification with Explanations
item.description: The proposed system first predicts inconsistent spans from claim and context; and then uses them to predict inconsistency types and inconsistent entity types (when inconsistency is due to entities).

item.title: Evaluation and Optimization of Gradient Compression for Distributed Deep Learning
item.description: To accelerate distributed training, many gradient compression methods have been proposed to alleviate the communication bottleneck in synchronous stochastic gradient descent (S-SGD), but their efficacy in real-world applications still remains unclear.

item.title: Relation-Aware Diffusion Model for Controllable Poster Layout Generation
item.description: To advance research in this field, we have constructed a poster layout dataset named CGL-Dataset V2.

item.title: The Split Matters: Flat Minima Methods for Improving the Performance of GNNs
item.description: We investigate flat minima methods and combinations of those methods for training graph neural networks (GNNs).

item.title: Hierarchical confusion matrix for classification performance evaluation
item.description: Finally, we use measures based on the novel confusion matrix to evaluate models within a benchmark for three real world hierarchical classification applications and compare the results to established evaluation measures.

item.title: A Self-Supervised Miniature One-Shot Texture Segmentation (MOSTS) Model for Real-Time Robot Navigation and Embedded Applications
item.description: Determining the drivable area, or free space segmentation, is critical for mobile robots to navigate indoor environments safely.

item.title: FFB: A Fair Fairness Benchmark for In-Processing Group Fairness Methods
item.description: This paper introduces the Fair Fairness Benchmark (\textsf{FFB}), a benchmarking framework for in-processing group fairness methods.
